alert.note: Alert for Edmunds; Faulk (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 07 at 6:36PM MDT until May 07 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: The National Weather Service in Aberdeen has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Edmunds County in north central South Dakota... Northern Faulk County in north central South Dakota... * Until 1130 PM CDT. * At 736 PM CDT, Emergency Management in Edmunds County reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across and near the warned area. Ditches are reported full and some area roads have been overtopped with water. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 2 hours. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ipswich, Cresbard, Seneca, Chelsea, Onaka, Blumengard Colony, Norbeck, Loyalton, Pembrook Colony, Brentwood Colony, Cravens Corner, North Scatterwood Lake and South Scatterwood Lake. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
